item.title: Raúl add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Raúl add a quote by haruki murakami
item.description: "Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional." -- haruki murakami

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Haruki Marukami
item.description: "Whatever it is you're seeking won't come in the form you're expecting." -- Haruki Marukami

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "Lo malo de estas cosas es que, hasta que el rabo no pasa, todo es toro." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Isobel Thrilling
item.description: "I don't just want your heart I want your flesh, your skin and blood and bones, your voice, your thoughts your pulse and most of all your fingerprints, everywhere." -- Isobel Thrilling

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Why do people have to be this lonely? What's the point of it all? Millions of people in this world, all of them yearning, looking to others to satisfy them, yet isolating themselves. Why? Was the earth put here just to nourish human loneliness?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you remember me, then I don't care if everyone else forgets." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "Never trust a man who reads only one book." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "You don't choose your friends, they choose you, and you either reject them or you accept them without reservations." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "Actually loneliness has a kind of fascination; it's a state of egotistical, inner grace that you can achieve only by standing guard on old, forgotten roads that no one travels anymore." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "Because God and the devil could be one and the same thing, and everybody understood it in his own way." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Perez-Reverte
item.description: "I once wrestled with an angel. He won, but I learned a few things." -- Arturo Perez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "Nadie debería irse sin dejar una Troya ardiendo a sus espaldas." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "What about the future?" "We'll talk about the future when it gets here." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "he looked around at the books on the walls, at their dark, worn spines, and he seemed to hear a strange, distant murmur coming from them. each of the closed books was a door, and behind it stirred shadows, voices, sounds, heading toward him from a deep, dark place." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "You’ve just mentioned the price that has to be paid…Pride, freedom…Knowledge. Whether at the beginning or at the end, you have to pay for everything. Even courage, don’t you think? And don’t you think a lot of courage is needed to fight God?" -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "...the problem with words is that once spoken, they cannot find their way back to the speaker alone." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "El hombre..., cree ser el amante de una mujer, cuando en realidad es sólo su testigo." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "No era el hombre más honesto ni el más piadoso, pero era un hombre valiente." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "She loves you, loathes you, treats you well, then ill. Like a leech or a surgeon's knife, she's double-edged: sometimes she'll cure, but sometimes she will kill." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "Later, with time, I learned that although all men are capable of good and evil, the worst among them are those who, when they commit evil, do so by shielding themselves in the authority of others, in their subordination, or in the excuse of following orders. And even worse are those who believe they are justified by their God." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "The world is full of banks and rivers running between them, of men and women crossing bridges and fords, unaware of the consequences, not looking back or beneath their feet, and with no loose change for the boatman." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Perez-Reverte
item.description: "The pistol is not a weapon, it is an impertinence." -- Arturo Perez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "Pero el tiempo pasa, y dura. Y hay un momento en que todo se estanca. Los días dejan de contarse, la esperanza se desvanece... Es entonces cuando te conviertes en prisionero real. Profesional, por decirlo de algún modo. Un prisionero paciente." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "El heroísmo ajeno siempre conmueve una barbaridad." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "[L]ife is like an expensive restaurant where, sooner or later, someone always hands you the bill, which is not to say that you should deny the joy and pleasure afforded by the dishes already eaten." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Arturo Pérez-Reverte
item.description: "Los filósofos griegos tenían razón al decir que la guerra era la madre de todas las cosas." -- Arturo Pérez-Reverte

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Lighthouses don’t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Raúl add a quote by Joaquin Sabina
item.description: "Si quieres olvidarme date prisa, no me consuela tu amistad, tu duda..." -- Joaquin Sabina
